byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Thomas Kaplan, Yamiche Alcindor, Patrick Healy and Giovanni Russonello.

abstract: News Analysis; Democrats and Republicans are being forced to reckon with public distaste for presidential front-runners Hillary Clinton and Donald J Trump, even as candidates gain more support and amass more delegates; large part of electorate has already formed fixed, and often negative, opinion about Trump and Clinton following their decades spent in public eye.
lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton’s resounding triumphs on Tuesday masked a profound, historic and unusual reality: Most Americans still don’t like him. Or her.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Are Winning Votes, but Not Hearts
headline.print_headline: Clinton and Trump Pile Up the Delegates

snippet: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton’s resounding triumphs on Tuesday masked a profound, historic and unusual reality: Most Americans still don’t like him. Or her.
